Class TravellingSalesman

  • java.lang.Object
    • TravellingSalesman

  • public class TravellingSalesman
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a solution to the travelling salesman problem using A* Search
    Author:
    John Brockway

      Constructor and Description

      The generalized implementation of A* Search

      A function to get the neighbours of any node in the search tree as well as their respective distances from the current state

      Recursively calculates the heuristic for A*; in this case, finds the minimum spanning tree of the unvisited cities

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function which converts the input into a form usable by the search method
        Parameters:
        args - Contains the file path of the problem instance, which is in a specified form of "#-of-cities\nName x-Coordinate yCoordinate\nName x-Coordinate yCoordinate etc."

      • aStarSearch

        public static State aStarSearch(City[] cities)
        The generalized implementation of A* Search
        Parameters:
        cities - A list of City that represents every single city in the problem
        Returns:
        A complete State, with all nodes included in the path, and the path being optimal

      • heuristic

        public static double heuristic(City startCity,
                               java.util.ArrayList<City> tree,
                               java.util.ArrayList<City> unvisitedCities)
        Recursively calculates the heuristic for A*; in this case, finds the minimum spanning tree of the unvisited cities
        Parameters:
        startCity - Where the tour started
        tree - The incomplete, currently constructed tree of unvisited cities (empty before first iteration)
        unvisitedCities - The list of cities not visited and not yet in the tree
        Returns:
        The cost of the minimum spanning tree across unvisited elements of a particular state

      • getNeighbours

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<State,java.lang.Double> getNeighbours(State state,
                                                                            City[] cities)
        A function to get the neighbours of any node in the search tree as well as their respective distances from the current state
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the search
        cities - The complete list of cities in the problem
        Returns:
        A dictionary which includes the neighbouring states and their respective costs

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static double getEuclideanDistance(City a,
                                          City b)
        Gets the Euclidean distance between two points on a 2D plane represented by City objects
        Parameters:
        a - A City
        b - A City
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between a and b
